nodes.bodyText: ❓ Shouldn't the CQL be returned here if there is no user?

❗ This seems dangerous to try and load all persistence items into memory.  I think this could cause OOM if there are millions of persistence items being exported.  The dump command iterates through all records but writes them out and does not accumulate the results into memory.

  
    
      ddf/catalog/core/catalog-core-commands/src/main/java/org/codice/ddf/commands/catalog/DumpCommand.java
    
    
         Line 99
      in
      fc2fa5f
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public class DumpCommand extends CqlCommands {
If you go the stream route we can remove this variable
❓ Does this pass the format check? I thought we had a rule preventing this inline style

✏️ It would be nice to print out the progress bar.

  
    
      ddf/catalog/core/catalog-core-commands/src/main/java/org/codice/ddf/commands/catalog/CommandSupport.java
    
    
         Line 68
      in
      fc2fa5f
    
    
    
    

        
          
           protected void printProgressAndFlush(long start, long totalCount, long currentCount) {
since Export now does paging, it won't know the totalcount to keep progress.
I see.  I forgot PersistentStore does not have a way to get the total count. I am surprised that has not been an issues all this time.
✏️ I know this was moved from a different class, but I think the descriptiveness of the name can be improved. What do you think about something like addUserConstraintToCql?
❗ How many items do we expect to be in the persistent store? Is there a risk of running out of memory?
❗ The persistent store is used for other things besides notifications, like user preferences

❗ I have two concerns with this method.
The first is that it is unsafe since it could be called multiple times and I think would fail after the first call.  It would also be confusing because the key would still have the binary suffix but would now have a string value.
My second concern is that this is not really a concern of this class.  There are many different ways to encode binary data.  I think this should be moved to to the store commands which have a concern on how to serialize the data.  Base64 decoding is already done in the store import command.  The store export command should do Base64 encoding to keep the command format symmetry in one package.  Another option is to create a GSON converter like this gist example to use in the commands.
https://gist.github.com/orip/3635246
If you do that, it might be useful to add to our GSON type adapters.
https://github.com/codice/ddf/blob/master/libs/gson-support/src/main/java/org/codice/gsonsupport/GsonTypeAdapters.java#L38
✏️ Might be nice to expose this date format (package private) in StoreExportCommand and import it here so they don't get out of sync

❗ We might have a problem with this call on SolrCloud since it looks like we do not sort to guarantee consistent ordering between shards.
https://github.com/codice/ddf/blob/master/platform/persistence/platform-persistence-core-impl/src/main/java/org/codice/ddf/persistence/internal/PersistentStoreImpl.java#L191-L194
We have to sort by ID to avoid this issue with the catalog dump command

  
    
      ddf/catalog/core/catalog-core-commands/src/main/java/org/codice/ddf/commands/catalog/DumpCommand.java
    
    
         Line 253
      in
      fc2fa5f
    
    
    
    

        
          
           SortBy sort = new SortByImpl(Core.ID, SortOrder.ASCENDING);
add default ID sorting on PersistentStore https://github.com/codice/ddf/pull/5745/files#diff-0927a922dc7dab1b936e3721db97721aR193
✏️ I think this could cause OOM is too many files are stored at once.  We could do the files in batches to avoid one map getting too large.

❓ Couldn't this command print +100k lines if there were a lot of items or large items in the persistent store?
Should we have a default limit of lines to print like 10 but a command option could increase it?
